persistent_identifier.notes: ID field contains DOI URL format

values.title: Bridge2AI-Voice - An ethically-sourced, diverse voice dataset linked to health information
values.description: The Bridge2AI-Voice project creates an ethically sourced flagship dataset...

landing_page_and_resources.notes: Landing page provided but no hierarchical resources structure

hierarchical_structure.notes: No parent_datasets or related_datasets fields present

license_and_use_terms.description: Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access License. Only registered users who sign the specified data use agreement can access the files.
license_terms: Requires signing Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access Agreement

access_policy_and_restrictions.notes: License terms present, ip_restrictions not specified

download_url.notes: No download_url field, though access_urls in distribution_formats

distribution_formats.description: Dataset available via PhysioNet in Parquet, TSV, and JSON formats.

related_datasets_and_resources.notes: Subsets field provides related data components but not related_datasets structure. Awarding 1 point for subset relationships.

license_and_use_terms.description: Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access License. Only registered users who sign the specified data use agreement can access the files.
license_terms: Requires signing Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access Agreement

license_allows_reuse.notes: License specifies registered access with agreement

standardized_formats.notes: Format and encoding not explicitly specified in top-level fields

variable_metadata.notes: No variables field, though subsets describe data structure

discouraged_uses.description: Access requires signing the Bridge2AI Voice Registered Access Agreement. Use governed by the agreement terms.

use_guidance.notes: Use guidance provided via discouraged_uses and access requirements

ethical_reviews.description: Data collection and sharing approved by the University of South Florida Institutional Review Board.
review_details: IRB approval from University of South Florida

is_deidentified.description: De-identification using HIPAA Safe Harbor method. All Safe Harbor identifiers removed including names, geographic locators, dates, contact information, government identifiers, and biometric identifiers.

deidentification.notes: Comprehensive HIPAA Safe Harbor deidentification described

privacy_protections.notes: Privacy protections evident in cleaning_strategies (free speech transcripts removed, raw audio omitted). Awarding 1 point for comprehensive privacy approach.

informed_consent.description: Participants provided consent for data collection and sharing of de-identified research data.

vulnerable_populations.notes: Adult cohort explicitly stated in future_use_impacts. Awarding 1 point for documenting population restrictions.

subpopulations.description: Voice disorders (benign and malignant lesions affecting vocal folds)
Neurological and neurodegenerative disorders (including Parkinson's, ALS)

instances.description: Version 1.1 contains 12,523 recordings from 306 adult participants collected across five sites in North America. Most participants completed one session, with a subset completing multiple sessions.

variable_metadata.notes: Subsets describe data structure (spectrograms, MFCCs, phenotype TSV, static features TSV). Awarding 1 point for comprehensive structural metadata.

data_topics.notes: Data topics comprehensively covered in subpopulations and subsets

sampling_strategies.description: Participants selected based on membership to five predetermined disease groups from specialty clinics and institutions. Patients screened for inclusion/exclusion criteria prior to visit by project investigators.

quality_issues.notes: Sampling strategy documented, though no explicit anomalies field

version_number.notes: Version 1.1 mentioned in description and throughout but no explicit version field. Awarding 1 point for clear version identification.

version_access.description: Multiple versions available through PhysioNet. Files for v1.1 may no longer be available; latest version is 2.0.1.

version_access.notes: Comprehensive version access documentation with DOI for latest

updates.description: Version 1.1 released January 17, 2025 adding MFCCs. Project subsequently updated to versions 2.0.0 and 2.0.1.

update_schedule.notes: Update history present but no future update schedule specified

purposes.description: Create an ethically sourced flagship dataset to enable future research in artificial intelligence and support critical insights into the use of voice as a biomarker of health.

tasks.description: Enable AI research on voice as a biomarker for health conditions including voice disorders, neurological disorders, mood disorders, and respiratory disorders.

funding_sources.notes: No funders field present (Bridge2AI implied but not explicit)

grant_ids.notes: No grant IDs or award numbers provided

collection_mechanisms.description: Data collection using REDCap with custom application.
mechanism_details: Custom tablet application for voice recording
REDCap for clinical and questionnaire data

acquisition_methods.description: Voice tasks collected via standardized protocol including sustained vowel phonation using a custom tablet application with headset.
acquisition_details: Custom tablet application for data collection
Headset used for voice recording when possible
Standardized protocol across five collection sites

acquisition_methods.notes: Acquisition methods with direct observation flag

preprocessing_strategies.description: Raw audio converted to mono and resampled to 16 kHz with Butterworth anti-aliasing filter. Derived data computed using multiple feature extraction pipelines.
preprocessing_details: Spectrograms computed via short-time FFT (25ms window, 10ms hop, 512-point FFT)
Phonetic and prosodic features computed using Parselmouth/Praat
Transcriptions generated using OpenAI Whisper Large (free speech transcripts removed)

cleaning_strategies.description: HIPAA Safe Harbor de-identification applied. Free speech transcripts removed to reduce re-identification risk. Raw audio waveforms not released in v1.1.

software_and_tools.notes: Tools mentioned in preprocessing (openSMILE, Parselmouth/Praat, OpenAI Whisper) but no formal software_and_tools field. Awarding 1 point for tool documentation.

known_limitations.notes: No explicit known_limitations field, though limitations mentioned in future_use_impacts

ethical_reviews.description: Data collection and sharing approved by the University of South Florida Institutional Review Board.
review_details: IRB approval from University of South Florida

ethical_review_details.notes: Ethical review documented (conflicts not explicitly mentioned)

publisher.notes: PhysioNet platform evident from URLs and maintainers. Awarding 1 point for implicit publisher.

citation_and_doi.notes: DOI in id field (https://doi.org/10.13026/249v-w155), no citation field. Awarding 1 point for DOI presence.

documentation_links.notes: Landing page provided but no external_resources. Partial credit already counted in element 1.

strengths: Complete ethical use and privacy documentation (100%)
Strong technical transparency with detailed preprocessing
Excellent discovery metadata with identifiers and keywords
Thorough deidentification using HIPAA Safe Harbor
weaknesses: No schema conformance or standards documentation
No explicit biases or anomalies documented

doi_validation.notes: Primary DOI in id field (valid format). Additional DOI for latest version (2.0.1) in version_access. Both follow PhysioNet DOI pattern (10.13026/*).

grant_validation.notes: Bridge2AI project name indicates NIH Bridge to AI program funding, but no explicit grant numbers or funder metadata provided.

identifier_consistency.doi_consistency: id contains DOI, page contains landing page
identifier_consistency.version_consistency: v1.1 consistently referenced throughout (description, page URL, version_access)
identifier_consistency.notes: Strong consistency between identifiers and version information. Document clearly describes v1.1 while acknowledging newer versions exist.

semantic_completeness.purpose_summary: Create ethically sourced voice biomarker dataset for AI research on health conditions
semantic_completeness.ethical_framework: Comprehensive (IRB approval, HIPAA Safe Harbor, informed consent, registered access)
semantic_completeness.data_accessibility: Registered access with data use agreement via PhysioNet
semantic_completeness.notes: Clear scientific motivation and ethical framework. Reusability limited by registered access requirements and lack of schema/ontology conformance metadata.

technical_reproducibility.notes: Exceptional technical documentation with specific parameters. Collection and preprocessing methods clearly specified with tool versions and settings.

privacy_and_ethics.notes: Exemplary privacy protections exceeding HIPAA Safe Harbor. Multiple layers of protection including omission of raw audio and free speech transcripts.

limitations_implicit: v1.1 files may no longer be available
data_quality_assessment.notes: Strong documentation of what is included, but limited documentation of biases, limitations, or quality issues. Implicit limitations mentioned in context but not systematically enumerated.

versioning_and_maintenance.update_frequency: Multiple updates within 2025 (3 releases in 8 months)
versioning_and_maintenance.maintainer: PhysioNet platform team / MIT Laboratory for Computational Physiology
versioning_and_maintenance.notes: Strong version documentation with clear history. No explicit version field but consistently referenced. PhysioNet provides stable long-term maintenance.

fairness_assessment.notes: Strong findability and accessibility. Interoperability and reusability limited by lack of explicit schema/ontology conformance and provenance metadata.

metadata_density.notes: Strong ethical/privacy and technical method documentation. Weak in quality/limitations, interoperability, and dataset relationships.

version_consistency.check: Version referenced in description matches version in URLs and metadata

date_consistency.check: Release dates align with version sequence

identifier_consistency.check: DOI and landing page reference same dataset version

ethical_consent_consistency.check: Deidentification and consent align with distribution policy
ethical_consent_consistency.notes: HIPAA Safe Harbor deidentification aligns with registered access model

cross_field_validation.validation_summary: All cross-field consistency checks pass. No contradictions detected.

critical_gaps: No explicit funding information despite Bridge2AI program name
No grant IDs or award numbers
No known limitations enumerated despite implicit limitations
moderate_gaps: No variable-level metadata (though subsets provide structure)
No explicit version field (though version clear from context)
semantic_gaps.impact_assessment: Critical gaps primarily in funding transparency and limitations disclosure. Moderate gaps in interoperability metadata. Minor gaps in bibliographic completeness.

high_priority: Add funders field with Bridge2AI/NIH grant information
Enumerate known limitations explicitly (v1.1 availability, adult-only, no raw audio)
Add known_biases field addressing sampling and disease cohort composition
medium_priority: Include variable-level metadata or reference to data dictionary
Add citation field with recommended citation format
Link to related Bridge2AI datasets if applicable
low_priority: Add format and encoding at top level
Include download_url or clarify that access is via landing page
Consider content_warnings for health data sensitivity
Add release_notes or was_derived_from for provenance
recommendations.notes: Dataset already demonstrates strong ethical practices and technical documentation. Improvements would primarily enhance discoverability, interoperability, and transparency around limitations.

evaluation_provenance.evaluation_method: Semantic analysis with field presence detection and cross-validation
